definition: to delay handing over (payment, homework etc)
to hand over/to deliver/to pay (money)/to turn over/to make friends/to intersect (lines)/variant of 跤[jiao1]

sentences.english: Papers that are late will be penalized by one-third of a letter grade for each day late.
sentences.chinese: 報告遲交，每遲交一天將扣字母三分之一級。

sentences.english: Please note that incomplete applications or those received after the due date will not be considered.
sentences.chinese: 任何未完成或遲交的申請將不會被接受。

sentences.english: The buyer disputes with the seller on delay of shipment.
sentences.chinese: 買方與賣方爲遲交貨物發生爭論。

sentences.english: No point credit will be given for unexcused lateness exceeding 5 days.
sentences.chinese: 遲交作業超過5天將不可原諒，不會給予分數。

sentences.english: Consequently, it is difficult and unfair to seriously evaluate late problem sets.
sentences.chinese: 如果遲交作業題組者，就很難嚴格給予公平的評分。

sentences.english: A surcharge is levied on late applications.
sentences.chinese: 遲交的申請要收取附加費。

sentences.english: You hand in your exercise book late again. You ought to have handed it in yesterday.
sentences.chinese: 你又遲交了作業了，昨天你就該交的。

sentences.english: No late papers will be accepted.
I’m terribly worried about late shipment.
However, capturing this information still does not solve the business problem of late deliveries.
sentences.chinese: 不過，捕獲此信息仍不能解決業務的遲交問題。

sentences.english: If you deliver your homework late, you should refrain from looking at the solutions under any circumstances.
sentences.chinese: 如果你遲交作業，你應該在所有情況下避免看解答。

sentences.english: Papers submitted after the due date will be considered late and receive a grade reduction.
sentences.chinese: 截止日期以後繳交的論文視作遲交，分數降低一級。

sentences.english: It didn't take the teacher long to catch on that Tom always had excuse for being late with assignments.
sentences.chinese: 老師沒有多久就發現，湯姆總有遲交作業的藉口。

sentences.english: It should be noted that essays submitted late will not be accepted.
sentences.chinese: 應該注意的是遲交的論文將不予接受。
